newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Artwork Systems to float on Easdaq.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Artwork Systems to float on Easdaq.

text.p: Belgian-based graphic software firm Artwork Systems Group NV said on Monday it would float its shares on Easdaq, Europe's newest growth-stock market, on December 11.

Artwork Systems, which specialises in producing software packages for the labelling and packaging sector, is offering up to 4,244,500 shares, at between $10 and $12 each, Johan Pede of lead manager KB-Securities NV said.
The subscription period will start on Tuesday November 26 and close at the latest on December 6. The firm has never before offered its shares for public sale.
Artwork Systems has produced a full range of software that runs on Apple Macintosh, the leader in the graphic arts industry.

"The company's strategy is to extend its current leading position in its chosen niche market (packaging and labelling) and to become a market leader in the overall professional Pre-Press software market," the company said.
Artwork Systems has two subsidiaries -- Artwork Systems NV, its Belgian subsidiary, and Artwork Systems North America Inc., its U.S. subsidiary.

"We believe that Artwork Systems has a lead of about three years on potential competitors...we do not expect increasing competition from existing players for the next two to three years," KB-Securities said.
Kredietbank unit KB-Securities is the lead manager of the flotation and forecast an average growth rate for the financial years 1997-2000 of 35.9 percent for sales and 32.9 percent for earnings.
Artwork Systems' net revenues increased by 283 percent from financial years 1994 to 1995 and by 194 percent from financial years 1995 to 1996.
Total assets rose to 329 million Belgian francs ($10.5 million) in 1996 from 89 million francs in 1995.

In financial year 1996, Artwork Systems' total revenue was 402.6 million Belgian francs, a rise from 128.3 million francs in 1995. Its net profit after-tax was 220.9 million francs in 1996 compared to 53.7 million in 1995.
The company forecast growth to come mainly from the U.S. and Asia.
ArtPro, Artwork Systems' flagship product, is aimed at the packaging and label market. ArtPro Repro is a programme for colour publishing and general commercial printing markets.
The group's Belgian subsidiary and its French distributor Elcede France S.A. are involved in a legal proceeding with Barco Graphics NV, a unit of electronics firm Barco.
Barco is seeking a permanent injunction from further commercialisation of the ArtPro software in France, claiming it infringes a Barco software programme.
Quotations and trading on Easdaq will start on November 27.
